tig.descrip: Use of prepositions: Things (processes, services, etc.) are in the front-end and back-end. Actions (installs, work, etc.) happen on the front-end and back-end.
Use of prepositions: Things (processes, services, etc.) are in the front-end and back-end. Actions (installs, work, etc.) happen on the front-end and back-end.
to hotplug sth. into sth. Use 'remove at runtime' where the specific action of removing a component or device is concerned. For RAID devices use hotswap
If list entries start actions, use menu instead
Only used as a noun; as a verb, use “(to) boot using PXE” or “(to) boot via PXE” instead
Use when referring to starting, stopping, enabling or disabling a unit
only use when referring to the actual file (e.g. when editing it) and not the unit itself

tig.term: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

tig.descrip: Capitalized when speaking of application; for command, use kdump
In Uyuni documentation use the "{webui}" macro. It expands to "Web UI".
Use "Web UI" or for Uyuni documentation use "{webui}".
When opening a Web UI dialog, use "navigate to". Do not use "go to".
Used in the context of LDAP and storage

tig.term: Advanced Configuration and Power Interface button
Common Unix Printing System error policy

tig.descrip: technical name, use in technical documents or if a short form is needed

often in plural, “installation media”; only for physical sources of installation data for products; when physicality of the installation source is unclear or unimportant, use the more versatile term installation source;
specific format for e-mail storage, not a directory for e-mails
(to) log in (to sth.) via SSH, (to) connect via SSH (to sth.)
In English, this term should be always spelled using 'z' regardless if it's going to be used in UK or International English.
Context decides which of the translations is the most appropriate.
Following the noun or as an independent phrase, “on premises” must be used.
commonly used with RAID devices. For non-RAID devices use hotplug
only to use when referring to the package name. In any other context, use 'LVM' instead.
when referring to network DNS zones
when referring to network DNS zones
when referring to network DNS zones
when referring to network DNS zones

Europe, the Middle East and Africa

tig.descrip: always use with article, e.g. 'The OBS API allows different clients and external services to interface and use its resources.'
technical name and SKU name, use in technical documents or if a short form is needed
technical name and OBS name, use in technical documents or if a short form is needed
